page.title: 17Swyncombe embroidery group
page.content: It is organised by the Vicar's wife who is a member of the Embroiderers' Guild and a trained teacher of the subject. Approximately 8 people of all standards do the work. It is funded by the collection of pennies by many parishioners in St Botolphs pence boxes. The group is interdenominational and meets at the rectory. At present Falls for the pulpit and lectern are being made. The fabrics used are silks from 1860 to modern man-made fibres. Gold thread and kid are used as well as traditional materials. All the work is hand stitched and each person has their own work. The completed pieces are then assembled into the finished article.
